medical_history.chief_complaint: Delayed diagnosis of Classical 3/H9252-hydroxysteroid dehydrogenase deficiency with salt wasting episodes.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Sibling 1 presented with episodes of severe sepsis and seizure at 20 months of age, with salt wasting indicated by plasma sodium of 124 mmol/liter. Symptoms progressed to premature pubarche by age 7 years 7 months. Sibling 2 experienced a sepsis-like episode at 19 months of age, also showing salt wasting symptoms. Both siblings' conditions were generally uneventful until referred for evaluation.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Sibling 1 had a previous hospitalization for severe sepsis and seizure at 20 months, and Sibling 2 had a similar episode at 19 months, with recorded salt wasting.
medical_history.family_history: The family was Caucasian and parents not consanguineous, with both girls being compound heterozygotes for mutations in the HSD3B2 gene.
